document_title: Testicular cancer: Signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content: Painless or swollen lump on either testicle. If detected early, the tumor is small in size. However, without timely intervention, the tumor can grow much larger.; Feeling of heaviness in the scrotum: For example, one testicle may become hard compared to the other testicle or testicular cancer will cause the testicle to grow larger or smaller.; Feeling of dull pain in the lower abdomen or groin; Accumulation of fluid in the scrotum; Soft or developed breasts: This is a rare condition. Some testicular tumors produce hormones that cause breast pain or breast tissue growth. This condition is called gynecomastia; Lower back pain, shortness of breath, chest pain, bloody phlegm can be signs of later stage testicular cancer.; Swelling of one or both legs, difficulty breathing due to blood clots.

ung thu tinh hoan.json. Signs of testicular cancer
Painless or swollen lump on either testicle. If detected early, the tumor is small in size. However, without timely intervention, the tumor can grow much larger.; Feeling of heaviness in the scrotum: For example, one testicle may become hard compared to the other testicle or testicular cancer will cause the testicle to grow larger or smaller.; Feeling of dull pain in the lower abdomen or groin; Accumulation of fluid in the scrotum; Soft or developed breasts: This is a rare condition. Some testicular tumors produce hormones that cause breast pain or breast tissue growth. This condition is called gynecomastia; Lower back pain, shortness of breath, chest pain, bloody phlegm can be signs of later stage testicular cancer.; Swelling of one or both legs, difficulty breathing due to blood clots.
